src:
Budućnost dobila trenera: Lozničanin Milinković umesto Branka Brnovića
Srpski stručnjak preuzima ulogu šefa struke podgoričkog kluba

01 Nov 2019

Nakon pomalo šokantne smene šefa stručnog štaba podgoričke Budućnosti, legendarnog Branka Brnovića iako je tim prvi na tabeli crnogorskog šampionata, danas je stigla zamena.
Kao što se i pretpostavljalo posao će preuzeti srpski sručnjak sa velikim međunarodnim iskustvom, Mladen Milinković , a ovo je potvrdio novi sportski direktor plavo-belih, Zvezdan Milošević. Ovaj 51-godišnji Lozničanin će napustiti klupu drugoligaškog fenjeraša Sirijanske i preći u Crnu Goru posle vikenda pošto se u Švedskoj takmičenje završava za dva dana.
Milinković je tokom fudbalske karijere uglavnom igrao u nižerazrednim klubovima po Zapadnoj Srbiji, ali i u finskoj i Grčkoj, a od poznatijih klubova šef struke je bio u Loznici, Borči, surduličkom Radniku (2014/15), da bi potom vodio Luftetu i Kukeši kada je u Albaniji proglašen za najboljeg trenera. Iz Kukešija je potom otišao u Azerbejdžan za kormilo Kešle (bivši Inter Baku), da bi onda preuzeo Sirijansku, poznati švedski klub koji su 1977. osnovale sirijsko-aramejske izbeglice u Sederteljeu.




(Foto: Starsport)
text:
Future gets coach: Loznicanin Milinkovic instead of Branko Brnovic
Serbian expert assumes the role of head of the Podgorica club profession

01 Nov 2019

After a somewhat shocking dismissal of Podgorica's future head of professional staff, legendary Branko Brnovic, even though the team is the first in the Montenegrin championship standings, a replacement has arrived today.
As expected, the job will be taken over by a Serbian expert with extensive international experience, Mladen Milinkovic, and this has been confirmed by the new sports director of blue and white, Zvezdan Milosevic. This 51-year-old Loznican will leave the club's second-league lantern Syrianska and move to Montenegro after the weekend as the competition ends in Sweden in two days.
During his football career, Milinkovic played mostly in lower-class clubs across Western Serbia, but also in Finland and Greece, and from the more famous clubs, he was head of the profession in Loznica, Borca, Surdulic Radnik (2014/15), then led Lufteta and Kukesha when was named best coach in Albania. From Kukeshi, he then went to Azerbaijan for the helm of Kashle (formerly Inter Baku), then took over Syrian, a famous Swedish club founded in 1977 by Syrian-Aramaic refugees in Sedertel.




(Photo: Starsport)
